name: Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok

reviews.title: Beautiful Oriental
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 days at Oriental to celebrate our anniversary. We were upgraded to a deluxe room in the older section. The room was beautiful. Flowers everywhere. Complimentary wine, cake, fruit platter and CD player supplied with a small selection of CDs that were perfect. We also stayed at the Peninsula and whilst it is also beautiful with lovely staff it is different. The main difference with the Oriental is the atmosphere. Everywhere I looked I saw a photo opportunity. There are beautiful furnishings and flowers everywhere! The pools are lovely. The Foyer suberb, staff really go out of there way for you. It is such an interesting place to wander around. Feels more like a beautiful old home than a modern hotel. Our room was so lovely, full of silk and flowers, I was tempted to stay in it all day!

reviews.title: Lovely stay!!
reviews.text: Will definitely be back! Have submitted a video of our room.

likes.liked: — The service, comforts and of course, the spa!
likes.disliked: — The far distance to any major shopping or tourist attraction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had completed my six week tour of Thailand and had decided on a whim to stay here for my last night. I had to chuckle however at the sign that was outside of their hotel that stated that anyone wearing flip flops and carrying backpacks were not allowed in; as that described me exactly. That didn't stop me and neither did they.
reviews.title: Best Hotel EVER!
One of the Worlds best Hotels
reviews.text: As a single, young, female traveler, I must say at first I felt very intimidated by the older clientele. However, after touring around the lovely property, and having a drink on their outside patio, I felt very relaxed and comfortable. I had booked a 6 hour spa session and I highly recommend it for anyone looking to unwind. The little boats that took you to the spa on the other side of the river were lovely and they really treated you like royalty at the spa. The room I had was amazing and filled with all the small comforts of home: a CD player with surround sound, turn-down service, lovely fruit and an amazing mini-bar - and you must understand, after 6 weeks in staying in hostels and living out of my backpack, I was like a little kid in a candy store.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my flight was at 7:30AM, I had arranged a limo service from the hotel to the airport. And was it ever worth it! As I was checking out, my bags were already waiting in the limo - their new line of BMW's 7 Series. When I arrived at the airport, there was someone waiting for me that put my bags on the trolley and walked with me through check in.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience ever

reviews.text: I have encountered many gracious staff with exemplery courteous service at Mandarin Oriental from the greeters and conceirge to the boatman of the hotel.
reviews.title: The staff at the gym could be more respectful
An Oasis of True Oriental Civization
reviews.text: However on 8 Aug 2013, I encountered some disrespectful behaviour specifically at the hotel gym. It was regarding the timing that I was allowed to use the gym. The information was communicated to me in Thai language. Although I can speak a little Thai I could not understand some words.. The staff could have been more polite and clear in their communication.
However I was reprimanded.
reviews.title: Fascinating location with outstanding staff still one of the best hotels worldwide

reviews.text: This solo experience does not distract from the lovely hotel interiors and other nice staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Level of Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel all over the world and this hotel always ranks in my top three. The service is as impeccable as you'll find anywhere. The facilities are always classy, and not just clean, but shining. Flowers of the most unusual kind in all sorts of arrangements all over the hotel (my wife pointed this out, but it's impressive even forva guy). The staff are pleasant and helpful without being obtrusive; they do make you feel like you're staying in their home bc they take so much pride in the place.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: The Oriental is a truly special hotel. Service is exceptional and the location on the river are truly stunning. Rooms are nice and extra touches like the welcome juice and daily fruits are a nice touch. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because while it is truly fabulous, other Bangkok hotels are really giving the Oriental a run for its money (literally).
reviews.title: An Institution in It's Own Right

likes.disliked: — Expected it to stand out more (other hotels are following suit and doing it well)

reviews.text: Highly recommended nonetheless.
reviews.title: Lush Lush Lush

reviews.text: On arrival we were greeted with orchids and juice, check in was very fast and room service exceptional.
reviews.title: Some Things Never Change (Thankfully!)

likes.disliked: — Local weddings shut down the Author's Wing

reviews.text: We had a room with a balcony, it was exceptional, my friend and still talk about that room. The bath was big enough to swim in, the closet the size of China and couches, we had just travelled Thailand for 3 weeks and decided to stay in, as it was just SO nice!
reviews.title: Perfect start to family holiday

likes.liked: — The staff, the views, the pool + the breakfast!
likes.disliked: — (the price - but worth it for the experience)

reviews.title: Best Hotel in The World
reviews.text: The breakfast and pool was lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again our stay in the Oriental Bangkok was a wonderful experience. Great atmosphere, great service, great food, great spa and a really wonderful Thai restaurant. The crew at the swimming pool is also extraordinary.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: We love it! :-) It was our 4th stay at the Oriental. And we will come back.
reviews.title: An elegant hotel with service from a bygone era

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel and a great change from the new era of glass and steel. It oozes charm and you can feel the history and sense of grandeur.
reviews.title: best of bangkok

reviews.text: We stayed in a suite with a balcony. Well proportioned and sized rooms, with the usual vast array of MO amenities.
reviews.title: fabulous cooking school

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sitting on the terrace for breakfast, by the river, watching the world go by is great. As is sitting in Ciao,by the river, for sunset cocktails as the waterway lights up.
reviews.title: The royal treatment

reviews.text: We booked our room months in advance and got a great rate of around $300/ night. Excellent service. Room is made up as soon as they see you leave. Fresh fruit, great ammenities. Took yoga class at the gym and had several spa treatments. Heaven. Wonderful boat shuttle service. Breakfast buffet was fabulous.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our friend forgot his laptop in the room when we were checking out. Because they check the room as soon as you leave, they were able to catch us as we were boarding the shuttle to the airport. We used their transfer service so they met us at the airport, guided us & our luggage to check in and brought us just about to the gate. Worth the money for that service alone.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in a river view superior room - the only negative thing was that we did not stay here for long enough. The hotel service was fantastic from the minute we arrived. Check in was done in our room and complimentary juice drinks were delivered straight away. Our personal butler came to introduce himself and was put to work within 5 minutes when I discovered I had forgotten to pack a hair brush - not a problem one appeared 10 minutes later.
reviews.title: No better hotel in Bangkok and few this good around the world

likes.disliked: — I think $20 /day internet fees are inappropriate

reviews.text: The room was well furnished and very comfortable and had a small balacony which looked over the river.
reviews.title: If only once in your life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was luxurious and had a lovely selection of bath and shower gels and lots of big white fluffy towels.
reviews.title: Everything you hope it will be

likes.liked: — Afternoon tea was the best I've had anywhere in the world (and I've had lots...)

reviews.text: Every time I visit Thailand I finish my trip with a few days at this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Old Classic

reviews.text: On arrival the greeting from the waiting hotel staff is regal.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.text: The rooms opulent and grand.
reviews.title: Luxury pure and simple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location on the Chao Phrya River timeless.
reviews.title: Sheer Luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa wonderful.
reviews.title: High tea,Somerset Maughan and attention to detail

reviews.text: I have stayed at this property a number of times, and it never fails to impress. The tropical lavishness of the decor and the flowers which adorn this property at every turn are just stunning. The property is like a small city, with everything you might want. Fabulous restaurants, interesting shopping, relaxing pool area, and the stunning patio for drinks at night. They even have a medical clinic with a doctor who comes in on weekdays for limited hours! How many hotels have that? In my experience, not many (any??).
reviews.title: Still the one...

reviews.text: And the location of the hotel is great. Bangkok is not a city for walking. Although we LOVE to walk, it just never works out in Bangkok. And believe me, we've tried it! So the Oriental's shuttle to the Skytrain is such a great way to start the day. The short boat ride, coupled with the high efficiency and cleanliness of the Skytrain makes getting around in Bangkok a breeze. Sure beats the old days of sitting in traffic. And I love the immediate area of the Oriental. Several nice shops on Oriental Ave. are about all the walking I want to do in BKK.
reviews.title: Fab

reviews.text: We are not people to hang around by the pool, but the Oriental pool is exceptional. I especially like the new "wading" pool that they put in next to the restaurant. It's gorgeous and serene. The big beds by this pool are fabulous for lounging and having a bit of lunch. We actually spent two mornings by the pool because it was so relaxing. The pool staff bring small treats around periodically too, so you really are in the lap of luxury.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive and formal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sala Rim Naan is another experience you don't want to miss at the Oriental. It's visually stunning, and such a special way to spend the evening. I appreciate the effort it takes to put on this wonderful show of Thai dancing. The room is beautiful, and it is just a short boat ride across the river. Don't miss it.
reviews.title: One of the top hotel experiences in the world, and for good reason

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to make your experience at the Oriental even better, I recommend the 16th floor. It is a floor of only suites...about 8 or 10. It feels intimate, the staff is great and the rooms are incredibly spacious. It's a treat, but well worth it.
reviews.title: Of course it's excellent ~ it's The Oriental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel costs 2x the price of a 'standard' 5 star hotel in Bangkok, but you better believe it's worth every dollar!
reviews.title: The best service I have ever experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is really 'phenomenal'. Good hotels in The West have excellent service. But the Oriental has something you don't find in luxury hotels in Europe or USA, which is: the service is not only excellent, but the number of staff is also very large.
reviews.title: Gorgeous but be wary of room 259

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This means there's always someone to help you, and they have as much time as you need. To take an example, when we took a hotel limo to the airport, the staff actually escort us inside and guide us to the airline desk safely. Even then they check 'everything OK, sir?', then they finally say goodbye!
reviews.title: A fantastic welcome to Thailand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I was recovering from a slight climbing accident and had some trouble walking, the Oriental was just the best place to stay in my condition.
reviews.title: Fabulous

likes.liked: — its soothing otherworldliness in a very big, very steamy city
likes.disliked: — we didn't eat outside the hotel at night because there were very few small restaurants nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff were ALWAYS very patient, sorting out any problem, and always showing genuine concern, even one time when I was a bit rudely blaming one lady for moving my walking stick (was actually completely my own stupid mistake, I realized after). We want to say thank you to them all once more in writing this review.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Elegant, Great Service

description: Colonial-style Hotel dates from 1876, traditional guest amenities, spa and sports center; on the banks of the Chao Phraya River.
